main event: On November 14, 1957, in St. Charles, Missouri, a civilian reported observing a round object with a triangular portion rotating. The round portion was white, while the triangular part was red. The object exhibited revolving, semaphore-like movements and no sound. It was observed moving up and down sideways for a duration of 1 hour.
interesting points: The object was described as having a round portion and a triangular part, with the triangular section exhibiting semaphore-like movements.
No sound was reported despite the object being relatively close, approximately 50 yards high.
The conclusion of the observation was that it was astronomical, possibly the planet Venus.
The witness was a civilian, and the observation was made using ground-radar equipment.
The object's maneuvers included moving up and down sideways, which is unusual for known aircraft at the time.
sighted object: round object with a rotating triangular portion
